channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report E-2025030236
item.description:
Report E-2025030236

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Approximately 1 pound of Potassium Hydroxide Flakes released from one 50 pound mesh bag due to a tear caused by improper loading. No Drains, Soils or waterways were reported impacted.

item.title: Report E-2025030188
item.description:
Report E-2025030188

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:36 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal URE. It was reported that approximately 10 ounces of Stratum Ultra R/I Primer Gray released from one 5-gallon metal pale due to a shipper provided pallet breaking during transit. The release impacted trailer #3213520. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report X-2025030431
item.description:
Report X-2025030431

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO ASSUMED LEAKER WEARING ALL PPE FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND PROCEEDED TO CONTAIN AND CLEAN UP SPILL. AFTER READING THE INVOICE SHE DISCOVERED THAT THE INVOICE HAD CLASS 8 UN1805. UPON INSPECTION REWRAP; NO LEAK. PHOSPHORIC ACID SOLUTION
